Chimera nodded, unsurprised of the answer.

Chimera: My point exactly. I won't show you what I can do because you 
will probably want me dead after. That is, I don't mind talking to a 
prisoner...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Hydras:
> 
> "I would rather a soldier alive... but I won't hesitate to kill a 
> fool whose dare challenge me"hissed Hydras
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Dracon: Aries, don't mees this up.
> > 
> > No one else could have heard that. From that point on, Aries was 
> in 
> > charge.
> > 
> > Chimera: What I can do... yes... Let me show you.
> > 
> > He transformed into a strange looking bot to say the least. The 
> > three heads formed a breastplate while a massive arm held a scaly 
> > whip. The other arm ended in the slim muzzle of a laser torch.
> > 
> > Chimera: I could show you what I can do, but I prefer to stay 
> alive. 
> > After all, what's good in joining someone when that someone would 
> > prefer you dead?
> >

fun.

stupid
